New Records: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points, the highest among all players in the match
Key Match Events: Celtics delivered a devastating 43-point first quarter, taking complete control of the game
Tatum produced an electric shooting performance to pour in 18 points from 3-point range over the two quarters
Pre-Game Insights: Tatum told the crowd, 'This is special. On behalf of me, my teammates, the organization, we couldn't have done it without you last year. Let's enjoy this moment together. I can honestly say, to the best fans in the world â€” let's do it again.'
Post-Match Reflections: The Celtics have retained the core of the team from last season's roster and look well-positioned to mount a serious defense of their title
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics celebrated raising its record-breaking 18th championship banner before the game

The Celtics powered to last season's NBA championship after winning 64 games in the regular season before dropping just three games in the playoffs, sealing victory with a 4-1 rout of the Dallas Mavericks in the NBA Finals
Others: Jalen Brunson led the Knicks scoring with 22 points, alongside Miles McBride with 22 from the bench
